Package camzup.pfriendly

Class Yup2

java.lang.Object
processing.core.PImage
processing.core.PGraphics
processing.opengl.PGraphicsOpenGL
camzup.pfriendly.UpOgl
camzup.pfriendly.Yup2
All Implemented Interfaces:
ITextDisplay, ITextDisplay2, IUp, IUpOgl, IYup2, java.lang.Cloneable, processing.core.PConstants
public class Yup2
extends UpOgl
implements ITextDisplay2, IUpOgl, IYup2
A 2.5D renderer based on OpenGL. Supposes that the the camera is looking down on a 2D plane from the z axis, making (0.0, 1.0) the forward -- or up -- axis.

  • Field Summary

    • defaultSettings

      public void defaultSettings()
      Sets the renderer's default styling. This mostly concerns camera defaults and settings which convert OpenGL to a "2.5D" renderer.
      Specified by:
      defaultSettings in interface IUp
      Overrides:
      defaultSettings in class UpOgl

    • handles

      public void handles​(CurveEntity2 ce)
      Displays the handles of a curve entity. The stroke weight is determined by IUp.DEFAULT_STROKE_WEIGHT, 1.125f .
      Parameters:
      ce - the curve entity

    • handles

      public void handles​(CurveEntity2 ce, float sw)
      Displays the handles of a curve entity.
      • The color for lines between handles defaults to IUp.DEFAULT_HANDLE_COLOR;
      • the rear handle point, to IUp.DEFAULT_HANDLE_REAR_COLOR;
      • the fore handle point, to IUp.DEFAULT_HANDLE_FORE_COLOR;
      • the coordinate point, to IUp.DEFAULT_HANDLE_COORD_COLOR.
      Parameters:
      ce - the curve entity
      sw - the stroke weight

    • handles

      public void handles​(CurveEntity2 ce, float sw, int lineColor, int rearColor, int foreColor, int coordColor)
      Displays the handles of a curve entity.
      Parameters:
      ce - the curve entity
      sw - the stroke weight
      lineColor - the color of handle lines
      rearColor - the color of the rear handle
      foreColor - the color of the fore handle
      coordColor - the color of the coordinate

    • image

      public void image​(processing.core.PImage img, float x1, float y1, float x2, float y2, float u1, float v1, float u2, float v2)
      Displays a PImage. The meaning of the first four parameters depends on imageMode. The last four coordinates specify the image texture coordinates (or UVs).
      Parameters:
      img - the PImage
      x1 - the first x coordinate
      y1 - the first y coordinate
      x2 - the second x coordinate
      y2 - the second y coordinate
      u1 - the image top-left corner u
      v1 - the image top-left corner v
      u2 - the image bottom-right corner u
      v2 - the image bottom-right corner v

    • model

      public Vec2 model​(Vec2 source, Vec2 target)
      Finds the model view position of a point.

      More efficient than calling PApplet.modelX(float, float, float) and PApplet.modelY(float, float, float) separately. However, it is advisable to work with the renderer matrices directly.
      Parameters:
      source - the point
      target - the output vector
      Returns:
      the model point

    • modelX

      public float modelX​(float x, float y)
      Takes a two-dimensional x, y position and returns the x value for where it will appear on a model view. This is inefficient, use model(Vec2, Vec2) instead.
      Parameters:
      x - the x coordinate
      y - the y coordinate
      Returns:
      the model x coordinate

    • modelY

      public float modelY​(float x, float y)
      Takes a two-dimensional x, y position and returns the y value for where it will appear on a model view. This is inefficient, use model(Vec2, Vec2) instead.
      Parameters:
      x - the x coordinate
      y - the y coordinate
      Returns:
      the model y coordinate

    • modelZ

      public float modelZ​(float x, float y)
      Takes a two-dimensional x, y position and returns the z value for where it will appear on a model view. This is inefficient, use model(Vec2, Vec2) instead.
      Parameters:
      x - the x coordinate
      y - the y coordinate
      Returns:
      the model z coordinate

    • origin

      public void origin()
      Draws the world origin. The length of the axes is determined by multiplying IUp.DEFAULT_IJK_LINE_FAC, 0.3499999940395355f, with the renderer's short edge.
      Specified by:
      origin in interface IUp

    • origin

      public void origin​(float lineLength)
      Draws the world origin. The axes stroke weight defaults to IUp.DEFAULT_IJK_SWEIGHT, 1.25f.
      Parameters:
      lineLength - the line length

    • origin

      public void origin​(float lineLength, float sw)
      Draws the world origin. Colors the axes according to IUp.DEFAULT_I_COLOR and IUp.DEFAULT_J_COLOR.
      Parameters:
      lineLength - the line length
      sw - the stroke weight

    • resetMatrix

      public void resetMatrix()
      Resets the model view and camera matrices to the identity. Resets projection model view to the projection. Resets camera axes vectors to the default.
      Overrides:
      resetMatrix in class UpOgl

    • rotate

      public void rotate​(float angle, float vx, float vy, float vz)
      Rotates the model view matrix around an arbitrary axis by an angle in radians. Not supported by this renderer.
      Overrides:
      rotate in class processing.opengl.PGraphicsOpenGL
      Parameters:
      angle - the angle in radians
      vx - the axis x coordinate
      vy - the axis y coordinate
      vz - the axis z coordinate

    • rotateX

      public void rotateX​(float radians)
      Rotates the sketch by an angle in radians around the y axis. For 2D, this scales by ( 1.0, cos ( a ) ) .
      Overrides:
      rotateX in class UpOgl
      Parameters:
      radians - the angle

    • rotateY

      public void rotateY​(float radians)
      Rotates the sketch by an angle in radians around the y axis. For 2D, this scales by ( cos ( a ), 1.0 ) .
      Overrides:
      rotateY in class UpOgl
      Parameters:
      radians - the angle

    • screen

      public Vec2 screen​(Vec2 source, Vec2 target)
      Finds the screen position of a point in the world.

      More efficient than calling PApplet.screenX(float, float, float) , PApplet.screenY(float, float, float) , and PApplet.screenZ(float, float, float) separately. However, it is advisable to work with Vec4s and the renderer matrices directly.
      Specified by:
      screen in interface IYup2
      Parameters:
      source - the point
      target - the output vector
      Returns:
      the screen point

    • setMatrix

      public void setMatrix​(float m00, float m01, float m02, float m03, float m10, float m11, float m12, float m13, float m20, float m21, float m22, float m23, float m30, float m31, float m32, float m33)
      Resets the PGraphicsOpenGL.camera and PGraphicsOpenGL.cameraInv matrices, sets the model view to the input values, calculates the inverse model view, then recalculates the projection model view.
      Overrides:
      setMatrix in class UpOgl
      Parameters:
      m00 - row 0, column 0
      m01 - row 0, column 1
      m02 - row 0, column 2
      m03 - row 0, column 3
      m10 - row 1, column 0
      m11 - row 1, column 1
      m12 - row 1, column 2
      m13 - row 1, column 3
      m20 - row 2, column 0
      m21 - row 2, column 1
      m22 - row 2, column 2
      m23 - row 2, column 3
      m30 - row 3, column 0
      m31 - row 3, column 1
      m32 - row 3, column 2
      m33 - row 3, column 3
      See Also:
      PMatAux.inverse(PMatrix3D, PMatrix3D)

    • setSize

      public void setSize​(int width, int height)
      Set size is the last function called by size, createGraphics, makeGraphics, etc. when initializing the graphics renderer. Therefore, any additional values that need initialization can be attempted here.
      Overrides:
      setSize in class UpOgl
      Parameters:
      width - the applet width
      height - the applet height

    • shapeMode

      public void shapeMode​(int mode)
      shapeMode is not supported by this renderer; it defaults to CENTER. Set the scale of the shape with instance methods instead.

      This will not throw a missing method warning, because it may be called by PShapes.
      Overrides:
      shapeMode in class UpOgl
